com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions

Class Multinomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core.FactorFunction
      • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.Multinomial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFactorFunction

    public class Multinomial
extends FactorFunction
    Parameterized multinomial distribution, which corresponds to p(x | N, alpha), where x is a vector of discrete count variables, N is the total count across all categories, and where alpha is a RealJoint variable vector of (not necessarily normalized) probabilities.

    The domain of each x variable must be a zero-based integer with maximum value N (domain 0 through N). If N is a variable rather than a constant, then the domain of each x must be range from 0 through the maximum value in the domain of N.

    Representing alpha as described, the conjugate prior for alpha is a Dirichlet distribution. Depending on the solver, it may or may not be necessary to use a conjugate prior (for the Gibbs solver, for example, it is not).

    The variables in the argument list are ordered as follows:

    1. N: Parameter indicating the total count
    2. Alpha: RealJoint variable containing probabilities
    3. ... x: A number of discrete count variable, where the number of variables must equal the dimension of alpha
    N parameter may optionally be specified as a constant in the constructor. In this case, N is not included in the list of arguments.
    Since:
    0.06

        public final double evalEnergy(Value[] arguments)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorFunction
        Evaluates the possibly unnormalized negative log probability density of the arguments.

        This must be equivalent to -log(IFactorFunction.eval(com.analog.lyric.dimple.model.values.Value[])(values)).
